gs_default.whenToUse: Quick layout checks, no customization needed

gs_custom.whenToUse: Custom frameworks, specific column counts, branded colors, responsive grids

purpleDefault.bestFor: Light backgrounds, general purpose, default choice

alphaGuide.recommendation: Use 25-38% opacity (40-60 hex) for subtle overlay

validationRules.gridColumn: When gs_custom: Recommended 4-24 columns (12 is standard)
validationRules.gridOffset: Usually matches alleySpace for visual consistency
validationRules.gridOnFront: Must be false before site launch (otherwise visitors see grid)

warnings: CRITICAL: Set gridOnFront: false before launching site (grid will show to all visitors if true!)
Custom grid settings (gridColumn, gridMaxWidth, etc.) only apply when gridSystemOpt: 'gs_custom'
Grid overlay can impact editor performance on complex pages (consider toggling off when editing)
Very high column counts (>24) may cause visual clutter and slow rendering
Fully opaque gridBGcolor (no transparency) will completely obscure content
gridDirection: 'rtl' mirrors the entire grid - use only for RTL language sites
Grid uses CSS custom properties (--tp_grid_*) - may conflict with theme CSS variables
Multiple Design Tool blocks on same page will override each other (last one wins)
Grid is page-level overlay - affects entire viewport, not just block location
commonMistakes: Forgetting to set gridOnFront: false before site launch (grid visible to visitors)
Setting gridSystemOpt: 'gs_custom' but not configuring custom values (uses defaults anyway)
Using gridBGcolor without transparency (100% opaque blocks all content)
Setting gridColumn too high (>24) creates visual mess
Not setting responsive values for gridMaxWidth/alleySpace on mobile
Using alleyBGcolor with high opacity (obscures gutters)
Placing multiple Design Tool blocks (only last one applies)
Setting gridMaxWidth in % instead of px (unpredictable results)
Expecting grid to show only in specific section (it's viewport-wide)
Using Design Tool in production instead of removing after design phase
bestPractices: Use gs_default for quick checks, gs_custom for framework matching
Set gridOnFront: false (editor-only) unless showing to client temporarily
Use 25-38% opacity colors (hex ending in 40-60) for subtle overlay
Match gridMaxWidth to your CSS framework (Bootstrap: 1140px, Tailwind: 1280px)
Use 12 columns for standard layouts, 16 for complex designs
Set responsive gridMaxWidth/alleySpace values (md/sm/xs) for mobile testing
Choose grid color that contrasts with your site's dominant colors
Remove Design Tool block entirely after design phase complete
Use distinct color (yellow/orange) when gridOnFront: true as reminder to disable
Document grid settings in site style guide for team consistency
accessibilityNotes: Grid overlay is purely visual - no accessibility impact when gridOnFront: false
If gridOnFront: true (client preview), ensure sufficient color contrast for grid visibility
Grid does not affect tab navigation, screen readers, or keyboard interaction
Transparent overlay does not create color contrast issues for content
No ARIA attributes needed - this is a development/design aid only
performanceConsiderations: Grid overlay uses CSS custom properties - minimal performance impact
High column counts (>24) increase DOM complexity slightly
Transparent overlays use GPU compositing - hardware accelerated
Multiple Design Tool blocks create CSS variable conflicts (only last applies)
Grid rendering is CSS-only - no JavaScript performance cost
Editor performance may degrade on complex pages with grid enabled
gridOnFront: true adds CSS to frontend (minimal ~1KB)
Remove block entirely after design phase to eliminate any overhead

designPhase.when: During initial layout design and alignment work
designPhase.settings: Use gs_custom with framework-matching columns (12 for Bootstrap, etc.)

clientReview.when: Showing layout to client for approval
clientReview.settings: Use distinctive color (yellow/orange), set gridOnFront: true temporarily

preLaunch.action: Remove Design Tool block entirely or set gridOnFront: false
preLaunch.verification: Check frontend in incognito mode - grid should not be visible

cssCustomProperties.important: All values use !important to override theme styles
cssCustomProperties.access: Can be accessed in custom CSS via var(--tp_grid_columns) etc.

problemsAndSolutions.solution: Ensure block is added to page. Check if gridBGcolor has transparency (alpha channel).
Set gridOnFront: false. Check for multiple Design Tool blocks (last one applies).
Verify gridSystemOpt: 'gs_custom' (not 'gs_default'). Custom settings ignored in gs_default mode.

problemsAndSolutions.problem: Grid columns don't match my framework
problemsAndSolutions.solution: Check gridColumn count, gridMaxWidth, and alleySpace values match your CSS framework specs.

problemsAndSolutions.problem: Grid too opaque, can't see content
problemsAndSolutions.solution: Reduce gridBGcolor opacity. Use hex values ending in 40 (25%), 50 (31%), or 60 (38%).
Remove duplicate Design Tool blocks. Only one should exist per page (last one applies).
Verify gridDirection: 'rtl'. Ensure site is actually RTL language (Arabic, Hebrew, etc.).

problemsAndSolutions.problem: Grid doesn't adapt on mobile preview
problemsAndSolutions.solution: Set responsive values for gridMaxWidth, gridColumn, alleySpace (md/sm/xs breakpoints).
